title: Taj Mahal & Toumani Diabate - Kulanjan (1999)
description:
Perennial blues road warrior Taj Mahal and Malian kora (harp-lute) ambassador Toumani DiabatÃƒÂ© join forces, blend textures, and intermingle idioms on Ã¢â‚¬Å“KulanjanÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, recorded in 1998 in Athens, GA. 
The sound is defiantly acoustic, intimate, and surprisingly true. 

Ultimately, though, deciding which of the album's tracks can be termed as 'blues' and which are 'Malian' is a fairly pointless exercise. Taj and DiabatÃƒÂ© effortlessly fuse elements of both musics, and in Ã¢â‚¬Å“KulanjanÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ they have produced a superb release that succeeds on its own terms.

In magical ways this music carries a message of joy, of life, of energy, of beauty, of peace, serenity, of a balance and harmony in the universe.
It lifts the spirits of all who listen.
